title: Calculate rate of disappearance of a reactant

content.question: Based on the information above, determine the initial rate of disappearance of <math alttext="X " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in experiment 1.

choices.label: <math alttext="16 molarity per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>16</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mtext>/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="32 molarity per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mtext>/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="64 molarity per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>64</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mtext>/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="128 molarity per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>128</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mtext>/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="64 molarity per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>64</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mtext>/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
